title: How to Close Your Laptop and Use an External Monitor

steps.title: Click the Start menu.
steps.content: Click the Start menu. This is the Windows logo. This method will work on Windows 10 and Windows 11 .

steps.title: Type change what closing the lid does.
steps.content: Type change what closing the lid does . Results will load as you type.

steps.title: Click the first option.
steps.content: Click the first option. The Control Panel will open to your System Settings for the battery. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click the drop-down menu for "When I close the lid".
steps.content: Click the drop-down menu for "When I close the lid". There will be two drop-down menus: On battery and Plugged in . You'll need to change the setting for both.

steps.title: Select Do nothing.
steps.content: Select Do nothing . Repeat this step for the other drop-down menu for "When I close the lid".

steps.title: Click Save changes.
steps.content: Click Save changes . This is at the bottom of the menu. Now, when you close your laptop lid, it will stay on instead of powering off. You can connect your laptop to a monitor and external keyboard for a bigger workspace.

steps.title: Connect your MacBook to the power supply.
steps.content: Connect your MacBook to the power supply. You won't be able to close your lid and use the external display on battery mode without the use of a third-party app. If you haven't already, connect your external monitor and keyboard to your laptop.

steps.title: Click the Apple menu and select System Settings.
steps.content: Click the Apple menu and select System Settings . On older devices, this will be System Preferences .

steps.title: Select Lock Screen.
steps.content: Select Lock Screen . On older devices, you'll select Energy Saver and then Power Adapter .

steps.title: Set "Turn display off on power adapter when inactive" to "Never".
steps.content: Set "Turn display off on power adapter when inactive" to "Never". On older devices, this will look like Turn Display Off After .

steps.title: Close your lid.
steps.content: Close your lid. The display will turn black.

steps.title: Press Space on your external keyboard.
steps.content: Press Space on your external keyboard. This will wake your display. You can also move a connected external mouse to wake it up.
